scenario:
The porcine vaccine market is expected to grow by USD 709.6 million from 2023 to 2028 at a CAGR of 6.4%. The market is driven by increasing prevalence of porcine diseases, research and development expenditure for porcine vaccines, and growing animal healthcare expenditure. Key factors driving market growth include growing demand for pork and gelatin, government initiatives for funding animal husbandry, and strategic initiatives by market vendors. The market is segmented by product (intravenous and intramuscular) and region (North America, Europe, Asia, and Rest of World). 

Leading vendors in the porcine vaccine market include Bimeda Holdings Ltd., Bioveta AS, Boehringer Ingelheim International GmbH, Ceva Sante Animale, Elanco Animal Health Inc., FATRO S.p.A., Formosa Biomedical Inc., HIPRA SA, Merck and Co. Inc., Phibro Animal Health Corp., Veterinary Provisions Inc., Vetoquinol SA, Virbac Group, and Zoetis Inc. The report provides a comprehensive market and vendor landscape, including information on upcoming trends and challenges that will influence market growth.
